scope.title: Chakra UI Link - Horizon UI
scope.description: Links are accessible elements used primarily for navigation

frontMatter.excerpt: Links are accessible elements used primarily for navigation. This component is
frontMatter.mdxContent:
---
title: Chakra UI Link - Horizon UI
package: "@chakra-ui/layout"
image: "components/link.svg"
description: Links are accessible elements used primarily for navigation
---

Links are accessible elements used primarily for navigation. This component is
styled to resemble a hyperlink and semantically renders an `<a>`.

## Imports

```tsx
import { Link } from "@chakra-ui/react"
import { ExternalLinkIcon } from "@chakra-ui/icons"
```

## Usage

```jsx
<Link>Horizon UI Dashboard</Link>
```

```tsx
<Link>Horizon UI Dashboard</Link>
```

### External Link

```jsx
<Link href="https://creative-tim.com?ref=docs-pud" isExternal>
  Horizon UI Dashboard <ExternalLinkIcon mx="2px" />
</Link>
```

```tsx
<Link href="https://creative-tim.com?ref=docs-pud" isExternal>
  Horizon UI Dashboard <ExternalLinkIcon mx="2px" />
</Link>
```

### Link inline with text

```jsx
<Text>
  Did you know that{" "}
  <Link color="brand.500" href="#">
    links can live inline with text
  </Link>
</Text>
```

```tsx
<Text>
  Did you know that{" "}
  <Link color="brand.500" href="#">
    links can live inline with text
  </Link>
</Text>
```

## Usage with Routing Library

To use the `Link` with a routing library like Reach Router or React Router, all
you need to do is pass the `as` prop. It'll replace the rendered `a` tag with
Reach's `Link`.

```jsx live=false
// 1. import { Link as ReachLink } from "@reach/router"

// 2. Then use it like this
<Link as={ReachLink} to="/home">
  Home
</Link>
```

```tsx live=false
// 1. import { Link as ReachLink } from "@reach/router"

// 2. Then use it like this
<Link as={ReachLink} to="/home">
  Home
</Link>
```

## Props

The Link component composes the `Box` component.

<PropsTable of="Link" />
frontMatter.title: Chakra UI Link - Horizon UI
frontMatter.description: Links are accessible elements used primarily for navigation
